definition: variant of 確|确[que4]/variant of 埆[que4]
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]

sentences.english: But due to lack of evidence, the court couldn't pass a sentence and released Chu temporarily.
sentences.chinese: 因无确凿证据，知府不敢草率判决，暂将朱尔旦释放。

sentences.english: They haudio-videoe first wind up asen the quiet force of progress throughout our history.
sentences.chinese: 这些价值是确凿的，是我们历史上前进的安静气力。
他讲的是确凿不移的实情。

sentences.english: You re'sly have an ear for pop music.
sentences.chinese: 你确凿对大作音乐很有欣赏力。

sentences.english: The case was dismissed in the absence of any definite proof.
sentences.chinese: 此案因缺乏确凿证据而不予授理。

sentences.english: The police have a clear case against the prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 警方掌握了不利于该罪犯的确凿事实。

sentences.english: But please show me your evidence so we're sure we've got our facts straight.
sentences.chinese: 不过你还得拿出证据来表明事实确凿。

sentences.english: Indeed, she now says she intends to sue for harassment, and justifiably.
sentences.chinese: 确实，她现在说她要起诉被骚扰了，并且证据确凿。

sentences.english: It translates these purported interactions into a mode perceivable and tangible to man.
sentences.chinese: 将这些飘渺的互动翻译为人可理解的确凿的。

sentences.english: She buttressed (up) her argument with lots of solid facts.
sentences.chinese: 她以确凿的事实支持她的论点。

sentences.english: The jury found the evidence against the prisoner inconclusive and acquitted him.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团发现控告罪犯的罪证不确凿，所以放了他。

sentences.english: Although conclusive evidence, but Hong Lin still has pleaded not guilty.
sentences.chinese: 虽然证据确凿，但林洪还是拒不认罪。

sentences.english: How can you tell he has murdered his neighbor in the absence of any specific proof?
sentences.chinese: 在缺乏确凿证据的情况下你怎能说他谋杀了邻居。

sentences.english: Have a valid reason for actions or words before issuing them.
sentences.chinese: 不要发出论点，除非你对行动或话语有确凿的理由。

sentences.english: The health consequences of this sedentariness are well-documented.
sentences.chinese: 久坐会带来健康隐患，这一点证据确凿。

sentences.english: He buttressed up the argument with lots of solid facts.
sentences.chinese: 他以大量确凿的事实支持这个论点。

definition: to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
